pageTitle: Ao Nang, Railay Wast, or Railay East?? : Travelfish Thailand travel forum
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {16723=My wife and I will be spending 4-5 nights in the area and are wondering which location would be the best. We want a beautiful beach to relax on at a good price. We will be in the area in late December., 6500=#9 Posted: 6/8/2009 - 11:35, 12427=#4 Posted: 5/8/2009 - 10:43, 15339=Joined Travelfish 31st December, 2007 Location New Zealand Posts: 2151 Total reviews: 20 Places visited: At least 107, 16892=Joined Travelfish 24th July, 2009 Posts: 5, 4913=Joined Travelfish 1st December, 2011 Posts: 25, 10836=#6 Posted: 5/8/2009 - 13:09, 7761=#8 Posted: 6/8/2009 - 08:23, 13182=#3 Posted: 4/8/2009 - 10:21, 5870=#10 Posted: 7/10/2012 - 22:57, 16492=#1 Posted: 4/8/2009 - 05:33, 11850=#5 Posted: 5/8/2009 - 12:05, 14990=I stayed at Sand Sea Resort last year which is in Railay West. They offered a 'stay for 4 nights, pay for 3 deal' - and I see that they still have this deal going. http://www.krabisandsea.com/Roomrates.aspx Cost for basic fan room is 1350/baht per night in low season, and 1950/baht high season (which is when you will be there). A fair bit more for aircon room (refer to the site for full range of prices). Personally, I would suggest staying in Railay West. You can get amazing sunsets, and there’s an OK beach for swimming. There is also a small 'walking street' that runs up away from the beach with a few shops, etc. The beach on the east side, whilst picturesque at high tide, is basically a mangrove ‘swamp’ at lowtide. The east probably has more atmosphere for the budget traveller (esp at night) - with more budget accomodation and restaurants. We walked to the east side each night for meals and had a drink or two at the 'Bob Marley' style bars. We were there in early June so it was reasonably quiet in there - which was perfectly OK with me. It might be quite different at Christmas time though. It only takes 5 mins to walk from west to east, so it probably doesn’t really matter which side you stay on. The nicest beach, however, is accessed from the East. I think there was one upper end resort there - but no one appeared to be staying at the resort! Go to the southern end of the east side, and find the track that follows along the cliffs for about 5-10 mins. Gorgeous sand, turquoise warm water – just awesome for lying back in the water for hours and staring up at the limestone cliffs. Hope that helps a bit., 9791=Joined Travelfish 14th April, 2008 Location Global Village Posts: 1979 Total reviews: 5 Places visited: At least 2, 9030=#7 Posted: 5/8/2009 - 20:12, 11551=admin Joined Travelfish 21st January, 2004 Location Indonesia Posts: 7221 Total reviews: 24 Places visited: At least 113, 4671=#11 Posted: 11/10/2012 - 01:35, 15636=#2 Posted: 4/8/2009 - 05:43, 6188=Joined Travelfish 23rd September, 2011 Location United States Posts: 14}
